content.raw: That's a great feature! Besides the browser dialog comment above, there was only another little thing which annoyed me. If I collapse all the current paths, and add another path, all the paths become expanded and it's hard to see the new one. That's a little detail, it's ok if we leave it for later.
content.html: That's a great feature! Besides the browser dialog comment above, there was only another little thing which annoyed me. If I collapse all the current paths, and add another path, all the paths become expanded and it's hard to see the new one. That's a little detail, it's ok if we leave it for later.

content.raw: I've addressed this issue, the list doesn't expand anymore when you add a new path.
content.html: I've addressed this issue, the list doesn't expand anymore when you add a new path.

content.raw:
It would be good to make it clear to the user that they successfully added the path. Ideally, there'd be a notification but we're not set up yet with notifications for Gazebo. 

Can you collapse all folders once the user has selected the new path? That way it's easier to find the new folder in the list. 
Also, are you able to list the new path at the top of the list?
content.html:
It would be good to make it clear to the user that they successfully added the path. Ideally, there'd be a notification but we're not set up yet with notifications for Gazebo.

Can you collapse all folders once the user has selected the new path? That way it's easier to find the new folder in the list. Also, are you able to list the new path at the top of the list?

content.html: Nice idea, I'll try to implement both (y)

content.raw: Please don't use underscores in variable names (as per our style guide). This would be `addPathButton`.
content.html: Please don't use underscores in variable names (as per our style guide). This would be addPathButton.

content.raw: sorry forgot about the naming conventions, its been a while since i made a PR to gazbeo.

content.raw: As per the style guide, all functions must be `CamelCased`. It would also be nice to have a more specific name for this button. So something like `HandleAddPathButton` or `OnAddPath` would be clearer.
content.html: As per the style guide, all functions must be CamelCased. It would also be nice to have a more specific name for this button. So something like HandleAddPathButton or OnAddPath would be clearer.
